title: [Self-Directed] Course for Enhancing Mathematical Application Competencies Based on Medical Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational understanding of statistics and ratio calculations, basic medical data interpretation skills
context.additional_context: Composed of 15-minute daily microlearning modules using mobile devices, linking real-life medical simulations with mathematical problem-solving

learning_goals: Learners can apply mathematical procedures to accurately analyze medical data (e.g., drug dosage calculations, diagnostic value interpretations)

In simulation environments, learners can address three emergency scenarios (hypertensive crisis, hypoglycemic shock, hyperglycemic crisis) by utilizing mathematical reasoning (mean/standard deviation calculations, ratio conversions, trend analysis) to present oral and checklist-based solutions meeting four or more of five decision-making criteria (1. risk level classification, 2. emergency action priority, 3. medication dosage calculation, 4. patient monitoring frequency, 5. follow-up plan) within 10 minutes.
Learners effectively select mathematical tools (ratios, percentages, graph interpretations, etc.) to simplify complex medical information
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
